original_title: National Chamber hosts 16-member Indian food and agri delegation
original_body_lines: The National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka hosted a 16 member business delegation from India, led by Global Fortune (GF Mission India) and arranged b2b meetings for the business community in Sri Lanka on 23 May at its auditorium.

The purpose of the visit was to explore and enhance export, import, trade and investment opportunities between Sri Lanka and India and the delegation was received by National Chamber Imports, Trading, Wholesale, Retail and Distribution Committee Chairman Haridas Fernando and Cargills Agri Foods Ltd. Deputy General Manager and National Chamber Secretary General/CEO Bandula Dissanayake to discuss potential opportunities between their respective industries.

The Business delegates were from the industries of agriculture, food and beverages sector such as rice, pulses, spices, dairy products, fresh vegetables and fruits, dry fruits, cereals, tea and coffee, sugar, bakery products, processed food, ready to eat, cooking oils, soya products, sweets, flour, beverages, and all other agri commodities.Sri Lankan companies who joined the b2b session presented their samples and product details and the Indian companies expressed their enthusiasm about the quality of products presented.
